as a note, I'm trying to convince people to move to a multi-continent map. While it changes little for you (there is still trade where it is now) it is a detail to be aware of. Also, a concern with large, irrelivent pantheons is less that they prevent player fun as they simply get ignored. Darker Dreams 15:33, 16 January 2008 (CET)

Religion Concepts

There are several options for the cultural religions of the different kingdoms, but there are only a certain number of categories these tend to fall into. The biggest of these categories, and some historical examples, are;

  • Monotheism- one overarching god, possibly with a (lesser?) malefactor opponent (the entire judeo-christian set, including islam)
  • Polytheism- multiple gods with a variety of relationships (Rome/greek, Egypt, Norse/celts, among others)
  • Animism- all things have their own spirits (Native american, many native african, Japanese/shinto)
  • Ancestor Worship- the great spirits of the society are the past heroes (and villans) of the culture. Individual ancestors are worshiped as "guardian angels," and intercessionary forces with the greater spirits.

As a note, I'd only use Monotheistic religions carefully, because of their closeness to such spots of modern sensitivity as Christianity and Islam. Regardless of the religious affiliations created, avoiding connections with real-world beliefs and symbolism is strongly advisable to avoid unnecessary strife.

"Good" v "Evil"

Thought; Cooperative evil is oximoronic- all evil seeks power for its own sake. For this reason, evil entities should generally be individually stronger than good entities (and provide their followers greater personal bonuses as a bribe to follow them/be evil) while good entities should be cooperative (and provide followers greater incentives to work together to get bonuses). While either side can disagree with its own fellows for both means and ends, good will cooperate better with good and is less likely to destroy other good. Evil really only cares about self-fulfilling power. To incentivize this sort of declaration among players, followers of Evil should get big personal bonuses, impose moderate penalties to those who work with them, and suffer big penalties against good. Good should grant moderate bonuses to good associates, get small personal bonuses, and suffer big penalties when fighting other good. ie; evil= offensive and personal, good= defensive and communal... Darker Dreams 06:55, 17 January 2008 (CET)

Lunar Dualism

When discussing a dualist religion for Oro, Alfonsoknaf stated that the concept is that moons would be a pair of brothers. After some discussion it was suggested that one be good while the other is evil. Idea; make them, on average, neutral gods- but make them bipolar. They are the providers of light in the darkness, and when they are brightest they are most benevolent. They are also the lords of shadow when they hide their faces. Their "good v evil" ratio is directly proportional to the fullness of each moon. Priests may worship one brother or the other, though this would require some sort of consistant goal for each brother. However, more likely, they would worship either the Benefactors who love and guide the people of Oro or the Malefactors who strengthen the Oro with tests and trials... Darker Dreams 18:27, 17 January 2008 (CET)

Religion Compatibility

With vastly different religions between the three kingdoms, I think it would be interesting if each of the religions were nevertheless somehow compatible with one another. The idea being that even with differences, each of the religions were basically "talking about" the same thing, showing some underlying commonness of religious thought between the 3 cultures. For example, the angels of a monotheistic religion could be the dieties of a polytheistic one. Rogue tribes would then probably have beliefs that resemble hybrids of the others. --Eklina 09:24, 24 December 2008 (UTC)
